titles: Hydriotaphia, urne-buriall, or, a discourse of the sepulchrall urnes lately found in Norfolk. Together with the garden of Cyrus, or the quincunciall, lozenge, or net-work plantations of the ancients, artificially, naturally, mystically considered. With sundry observations. / By Thomas Browne D. of Physick.
author: Browne, Thomas, Sir, 1605-1682.
publisher: Printed for Hen. Brome at the signe of the Gun in Ivy-lane.,
notes: "The garden of Cyrus" has separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
The final leaves are (1) "The stationer to the reader", (2) advertisements, (3) vertical half-title, "Dr Brown's Garden of Cyrus", (4) errata.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Urn burial --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Funeral rites and ceremonies --  Early works to 1800.
Symbolism of numbers --  Early works to 1800.
